underlying_goal: To create a reusable tool (a skill) for reviewing ML papers against a specific, high-quality rubric.
primary_success: Internalized a complex, domain-specific rubric and correctly instantiated it as a well-structured Claude Code skill, including a later refinement to move the large rubric into a `references/` file for better context management.
brief_summary: The user provided a detailed rubric for reviewing ML papers. Claude created a new skill, `review-paper`, to encapsulate this logic. Following user feedback, Claude refactored the skill to move the rubric into a separate reference file, improving its structure, and then committed the final result.
